cooking_method: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 30 seconds. In a small bowl, beat the eggs and Parmesan cheese together. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the cooked spaghetti and egg mixture. Toss to combine, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Divide the ground beef into four equal portions and shape each into a patty. Season both sides of each patty with salt and pepper. Grill the patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness. During the last minute of cooking, top each patty with a slice of American cheese. Toast the hamburger buns on the grill for 1-2 minutes, or until lightly toasted. Assemble the burgers by placing a lettuce leaf, tomato slice, and slice of red onion on the bottom bun. Add the cooked patty with cheese, and top with ketchup and mustard. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine the chicken pieces and buttermilk. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Heat enough vegetable oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven to cover the chicken pieces. Dredge the chicken pieces in the flour mixture, shake off any excess, and carefully place them in the hot oil. Fry the chicken for 12-15 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a wire rack to drain any excess oil. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375째F. Cook the macaroni according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk constantly until the mixture turns golden brown, about 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the milk and continue whisking until the mixture thickens, about 5 minutes. Add the shredded cheese and stir until melted and smooth. Season the cheese sauce with salt and pepper to taste. Add the cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and stir to combine. Pour the mac and cheese into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Top with panko breadcrumbs. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown and the mac and cheese is heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 300째F. Mix together the brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl. Rub the spice mixture all over the ribs, making sure to coat them evenly. Place the ribs in a large baking dish and cover tightly with foil. Bake for 2-2.5 hours, or until the meat is tender and falls off the bone. Remove the ribs from the oven and increase the oven temperature to 450째F. Brush the ribs with BBQ sauce and return them to the oven, uncovered. Bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce is caramelized and sticky. Let the ribs rest for a few minutes before cutting into serving-size pieces. Serve immediately with additional BBQ sauce on the side.

Preheat the oven to 200째F. Cut the chicken breasts into bite-size pieces. In a large bowl, combine the chicken and buttermilk. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 24 hours. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and black pepper. In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, melted butter, and maple syrup. Drain the chicken from the buttermilk and dredge each piece in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess. Dip the chicken in the egg mixture, coating it evenly. Heat enough vegetable oil in a large skillet to cover the chicken pieces. Fry the chicken in batches for 6-8 minutes per batch, or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a wire rack to drain any excess oil. Keep the chicken warm in the oven while you cook the waffles according to package directions. Serve the chicken on top of the waffles, and drizzle with additional maple syrup if desired.

Remove the skillet from the heat and add the cooked spaghetti and egg mixture. Toss to combine, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce. Serve immediately.
